nodes.text: The Knighting ceremony was a Jedi ceremony in which a Padawan, who, by the right of the Jedi High Council and will of the Force, was granted the rank of Jedi Knight. In it, a Padawan knelt before a Master, who placed the blade of their lightsaber just above the shoulders and head of the Padawan as they issued the statement, "By the right of the Council, by the will of the Force, [name], you may rise."

In 232 BBY, Jedi Padawan Keeve Trennis was brought before Jedi Master Avar Kriss on the Starlight Beacon by her own Master Sskeer. Expecting to be admonished for what she believed to be a failed Jedi trial on the planet Shuraden, she was surprised to find that she was instead being promoted to the rank of Jedi Knight due to her selfless actions in defending a Ximpi city from a swarm of ridadi.

Sometime during or prior to 40 BBY, Jedi Padawan Cere Junda was brought before the Jedi High Council to discuss the recent mission that had been assigned to her and her Master, Eno Cordova. As a result of her actions during the battle, a recommendation from Cordova, and testimonies from the Daa Security Forces and various Fylari survivors, the Jedi Council decided that she was ready to be promoted to the rank of Jedi Knight, and commenced her knighting ceremony.

In 14 BBY, prior to his mission to infiltrate Fortress Inquisitorius, Jedi Padawan Cal Kestis was knighted by the now former Jedi Knight Junda, who wielded the lightsaber of the Second Sister Inquisitor. To conclude the ceremony, Junda echoed the knighting quote that had once officiated her own accession to knighthood.

Years later, Kanan Jarrus, a former Padawan, went through a knighting ceremony during a vision in the Lothal Jedi Temple. In the vision, which was induced by Jedi Master Yoda, Jarrus was dubbed a Knight by an apparition of the Grand Inquisitor, who had once been a Knight and Jedi Temple Guard.
The Knighting ceremony first appeared in the Star Wars Rebels second season episode "Shroud of Darkness," that premiered on March 2, 2016.
